forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 13 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
A mix of serenity and anticipation envelops Downtown San Francisco as the night gives way to the promise of a sun-drenched Saturday. The low, lingering clouds have begun to retreat, allowing the first hints of brightness to emerge like shy guests at a gathering, while a gentle breeze sways, reminiscent of conversations shared under a warm sky. The morning brings with it the crispness of 57 degrees, beckoning locals to breathe in the cool, maritime air, punctuated by whispers of wind from the west-southwest.

As the day unfolds, temperatures will rise, enveloping the city in a warm embrace. With a high expected near 70, it will settle into a comfortable stride of 67 as the afternoon approaches, inviting residents and visitors alike to don light layers: a light jacket will perform splendidly against the playful gusts of wind, which may dance up to 28 mph. The landscape will be awash with sunlight, compelling outdoor adventures across the parks and piers. One might meander through the local market, savoring artisan treats, or simply lose themselves in the art-laden streets, where creativity and commerce intermingle. The day’s allure resonates with promise, urging you to revel in San Francisco's unique charm before dusk rolls in, whispering tales of the marine layer that has kept its distance for now.
